alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 8:02PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...This includes much of west central Sandoval County. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. High and fast water flows are expected in Cuchilla Arroyo, Alamo Arroyo, Bernalillito Arroyo and the Rio Salado. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Sandoval County - This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 26 and 45.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
